messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooing conference in Midwest?
messages.msgSnippet: I now I know why they did not have one this year. I don t know about the 2010 COnference but the first 2  in the past 2 years were only a one day COnference
messages.messageBody:
I now I know why they did not have one this year.
I don't know about the 2010 COnference but the first 2  in the past 2 years were
only a one day COnference with NO kids allowed.

 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

From: Melissa <sideshowmel@...>
To: "unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com" <unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, March 17, 2009 7:38:51 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooing conference in Midwest?


There is a conference in Wisconsin: http://www.unschool ingconference. com

I was just part of the formation of an unschooling group in South Dakota,
but thing we have a ways to go before we will be able to pull off a
conference.

HTH,
Mel (occasional lurker who always intends to contribute)

messages.subject: Re: unschooing conference in miswest?
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think there is a non-con (casual gathering, not a conference ) somewhere in Ohio but I think that s already passed. There s also Rethinking Education in
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "marykbright1" <marybright1@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, I'm new to unschooling and I'm very interested in going to a conference. So far, I've only seen info about conferences on each coast, which aren't feasible for me to attend. Does anybody know of any in the midwest this year?
>
I think there is a non-con (casual gathering, not a 'conference') somewhere in Ohio but I think that's already passed. There's also Rethinking Education in Texas (not exactly midwest but maybe closer than the coasts?).

--Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooing conference in miswest?
messages.msgSnippet: There s the Unschoolers Winter Water Park Gathering in Sandusky, OH - this year s has passed already.  There are talks and roundtables and funshops and all
messages.messageBody:
There's the Unschoolers Winter Water Park Gathering in Sandusky, OH - this
year's has passed already. There are talks and roundtables and funshops and
all kids of other things going on there, with unschoolers from all over.

I don't know the date's for the 2010 UWWG, but the website will probably
have it when the date's announced: http://ugoevent.com/

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooing conference in miswest?
messages.msgSnippet: No unschooling conferences in the Midwest. We just had an unschooling gathering in MN. We are going to do it again next year and it will likely develop into a
messages.messageBody:
No
unschooling conferences in the Midwest. We just had an unschooling gathering in MN.
We are going to do it again next year and it will likely develop into a small conference.
Here is a list of unschooling events in the US

http://familyrun.ning.com/events
 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

Subject: [unschoolingbasics] unschooing conference in miswest?


Hi, I'm new to unschooling and I'm very interested in going to a conference. So far, I've only seen info about conferences on each coast, which aren't feasible for me to attend. Does anybody know of any in the midwest this year?
